intro: Byttneria urticifolia subsp. rojasii, commonly known as the Mexican stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its stinging hairs on its leaves and stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically heart-shaped with a rough texture. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in rainforests or along stream banks. The subspecies rojasii is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and slightly different leaf morphology compared to other subspecies of Byttneria urticifolia.
